content:
• Monday, September 12, 2011
  • ITMN

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN) announces a concurrent secondary offering of up to 4M shares of common...

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN) announces a concurrent secondary offering of up to 4M shares of common stock - boosting its total outstanding to around 6.6% - along with $100M of convertible senior notes. Shares -6.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • EGHT

    8x8 Inc. (NASDAQ:EGHT) expands its cloud porfolio by acquiring privately-held Contactual Inc. in...

    8x8 Inc. (NASDAQ:EGHT) expands its cloud porfolio by acquiring privately-held Contactual Inc. in an all-stock transaction not to exceed 6.7M shares of 8x8's common stock. 8x8 has been successfully reselling Contactual's call center technologies as part of its business communications services since 2007. Shares +2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • ISIL

    Intersil (NASDAQ:ISIL) trades higher AH, despite cutting Q3 guidance. Chief Executive Dave Bell...

    Intersil (NASDAQ:ISIL) trades higher AH, despite cutting Q3 guidance. Chief Executive Dave Bell may have sparked an interest in the shares with his comments that the company is seeing signs of inventory stabilizing. Shares are now up +4.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) resumes trading after guiding its Q3 lower due to a significant...

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) resumes trading after guiding its Q3 lower due to a significant drop in earnings from it rolled steel division. The company blames a jump in raw-materials costs, difficult pricing and weak demand for the miss. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) cuts Q3 guidance, now expecting EPS in the range of $0.18 to $0.22...

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) cuts Q3 guidance, now expecting EPS in the range of $0.18 to $0.22 per share, below analysts' consensus of $0.29 per share. Separately, the company declares a $0.10 per share dividend. Shares -1.1% AH before being halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM
  • MIPS

    MIPS gained 6.2% on the day after activist investor Starboard Value, whose co-founder was named...

    MIPS gained 6.2% on the day after activist investor Starboard Value, whose co-founder was named Chairman of OPWV today, sent MIPS a letter declaring a 9.1% stake, nominating 4 board members, and urging the company to conduct share buybacks and "explore alternatives" for its intellectual property. (previously)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 3 Comments
  • ELMD

    Electromed (NYSEMKT:ELMD) reports Q4 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenues of $4.9M (+32% Q/Q)...

    Electromed (NYSEMKT:ELMD) reports Q4 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenues of $4.9M (+32% Q/Q) beats by $100K. Shares -4.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • SPWR

    Solar module vendor SunPower (SPWRA, SPWRB) announces its board has approved a plan to...

    Solar module vendor SunPower (SPWRA, SPWRB) announces its board has approved a plan to reclassify its two classes of common stock into a single class, and that the plan has approval of majority shareholder Total (NYSE:TOT). The company's Class B shares are up 7.3% AH on the news, while its Class A shares are down 2.9%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • RDN

    Radian (RDN -5.6%) dips after reporting a drop in its primary delinquent inventory from 110,607...

    Radian (RDN -5.6%) dips after reporting a drop in its primary delinquent inventory from 110,607 at the start of August to 109,990 by the end of the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • DIN

    It's mostly green numbers for the stocks of companies that serve sausage for breakfast....

    It's mostly green numbers for the stocks of companies that serve sausage for breakfast. DineEquity (DIN +5.3%), Cracker Barrel (CBRL +2.8%) and Bob Evans Farms (BOB +0.7%) are all solid gainers on the day, perhaps as investors view "bargain dining" becoming a more popular option for strapped U.S. consumers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • SVM

    Silvercorp (SVM -8.6%) gets hit today after it acknowledges that British Columbia's securities...

    Silvercorp (SVM -8.6%) gets hit today after it acknowledges that British Columbia's securities regulator is investigating allegations of company fraud. Silvercorp says it welcomes the investigation and is cooperating.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • JBLU

    Airline stocks respond to a positive Barrons article over the weekend: JetBlue Airways (JBLU...

    Airline stocks respond to a positive Barrons article over the weekend: JetBlue Airways (JBLU +2.5%), Delta Air Lines (DAL +0.5%), United Continental Holdings (UAL -0.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • ENOC

    EnerNOC (ENOC -3.2%) slides back into negative territory after jumping higher earlier in the...

    EnerNOC (ENOC -3.2%) slides back into negative territory after jumping higher earlier in the day. The stock had popped after Canada's Alberta Electric System Operator said it had chosen the company to provide additional power for its automated demand response network.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • FFNT

    FriendFinder Networks (FFN -3%) gives back early gains after saying it plans to buy BDM Global...

    FriendFinder Networks (FFN -3%) gives back early gains after saying it plans to buy BDM Global Ventures for $65M, in a move that gives the online dating company ownership of BDM's JigoCity deals site.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • BRK.A

    Shares of some of Buffett-appointee Ted Weschler's favorite stocks are not seeing a bounce today...

    Shares of some of Buffett-appointee Ted Weschler's favorite stocks are not seeing a bounce today following news of his Berkshire (BRK.A -0.6%) promotion, and look suspiciously like market laggards: W.R. Grace (GRA -5.9%), DirecTV (DTV -1.9%), Liberty Media (LCAPA -2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -7.6%) slumps after saying the run-rate of new, paid...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -7.6%) slumps after saying the run-rate of new, paid prescriptions for Acthar, a gel treatment for nephrotic syndrome, shows no significant improvment in Q3 over Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • BB

    The ranks of analysts expecting Research In Motion (RIMM -0.6%) to deliver healthy guidance (I,...

    The ranks of analysts expecting Research In Motion (RIMM -0.6%) to deliver healthy guidance (I, II, III)  when it reports earnings on Thursday continues to grow. Sterne Agee's Shaw Wu reports "constructive feedback" on recently-launched products, and thinks carriers are motivated to support RIM as an alternative to Android (NASDAQ:GOOG) and iOS (NASDAQ:AAPL).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • QTWW

    Quantum Fuel Systems (QTWW -5.9%) continues to drift lower after announcing a secondary offering...

    Quantum Fuel Systems (QTWW -5.9%) continues to drift lower after announcing a secondary offering of up to $75M. The offering is significant, considering the alternative-energy company's current market cap is only around $47 million.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • SWSH

    Shares of Swisher Hygiene (SWSH +4.9%) gain after the firm announces it acquired Go Hospitality...

    Shares of Swisher Hygiene (SWSH +4.9%) gain after the firm announces it acquired Go Hospitality Services to boost its presence in the Atlanta market. This summer, the firm has made over ten acquisitions - each of them small - as part of a strategic plan to gain inroads into large cleaning markets one at a time.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • VELTF

    Mobile ad provider Velti (VELT) is down 17.2% on high volume, creating fresh post-IPO lows along...

    Mobile ad provider Velti (VELT) is down 17.2% on high volume, creating fresh post-IPO lows along the way. Shares appears to be affected by the company's strong dependence on European sales. Other Euro tech names under pressure: ERIC -6.7%. NOK -3%. ALU -6.1%. SAP -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • DGIT

    DG FastChannel (DGIT -3.7%) shares are hit by dual valuation downgrades from Piper Jaffray and...

    DG FastChannel (DGIT -3.7%) shares are hit by dual valuation downgrades from Piper Jaffray and Craig-Hallum. Both firms cite concerns over the company's slowing revenue and a diminished macro outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • MU

    Micron Technology (MU +3.1%) is the S&P's top performer after UBS adds the chipmaker to its...

    Micron Technology (MU +3.1%) is the S&P's top performer after UBS adds the chipmaker to its "most preferred" list based on an expected bottoming in DRAM memory chip pricing. The brokerage expects the only U.S.-based manufacturer of DRAM modules to gain from production cuts at Asian rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • SU

    Suncor Energy (SU -3.5%) is down today after BMO Capital cut the shares to market perform,...

    Suncor Energy (SU -3.5%) is down today after BMO Capital cut the shares to market perform, citing deteriorating commodity fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • CAR

    Investors apparently aren't thrilled with Budget Group's (CAR -3.5%) guidance for Q3. Despite...

    Investors apparently aren't thrilled with Budget Group's (CAR -3.5%) guidance for Q3. Despite saying that adjusted earnings will be at the highest level of any quarter in its history, revenues will only increase marginally to $1.6B, near in-line with consensus estimates of $1.58B.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • P

    Shares of Pandora (P -8.5%) continue a downward march as the company faces competition seemingly...

    Shares of Pandora (P -8.5%) continue a downward march as the company faces competition seemingly coming from all directions. The latest is today's launch of Clear Channel's (CCO -1.9%) iHeartRadio, set to offer ad-free digital radio to subscribers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • LUV

    Southwest Airlines (LUV -2.7%) trades lower today after Raymond James cut the shares to market...

    Southwest Airlines (LUV -2.7%) trades lower today after Raymond James cut the shares to market perform on decelerating monthly revenue growth and a rise in fuel hedging costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • IRET

    Senior living property manager Investors Real Estate (IRET +6.8%) trades higher at mid-day after...

    Senior living property manager Investors Real Estate (IRET +6.8%) trades higher at mid-day after Baird ups its rating to outperform on valuation and a solid Q1 earnings report on Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • WLT

    Coal stocks decline even sharper than other energy stocks after going on a wild runup last week...

    Coal stocks decline even sharper than other energy stocks after going on a wild runup last week fueled by buyout rumors. Decliners: WLT -5.5%, LLEN -5.1%, ANR -3.9%, ACI -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • IPHI

    Chip maker Inphi (IPHI +7.8%) gets a boost from Piper Jafray initiating coverage with an...

    Chip maker Inphi (IPHI +7.8%) gets a boost from Piper Jafray initiating coverage with an overweight rating, giving added lift to the M&A updraft already pulling it higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • GEC

    Wireless software developer Openwave (OPWV), whose shares surged two weeks ago after suing AAPL...

    Wireless software developer Openwave (OPWV), whose shares surged two weeks ago after suing AAPL and RIMM, is down 3.8% after announcing CEO Ken Denman has resigned for personal reasons. In addition, the company has appointed Peter Feld, whose hedge fund owns a 9.9% stake in Openwave, as Chairman.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • RDCM

    RADCOM (RDCM +10.6%) pops after announcing earlier that it's received $6.5M in additional orders...

    RADCOM (RDCM +10.6%) pops after announcing earlier that it's received $6.5M in additional orders from one of Latin America's major multinational mobile telecommunications groups.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • SLS

    RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII +16%) pops after the firm gives a positive update on its phase 3...

    RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII +16%) pops after the firm gives a positive update on its phase 3 clinical trial of NeuVax, a cancer immunotherapy targeted for breast cancer patients not eligible for other treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) is up 1.6% after Jefferies calls it "the most mis-priced stock in...

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) is up 1.6% after Jefferies calls it "the most mis-priced stock in our coverage universe." Jefferies notes Express Scripts' pending merger with Medco Health (NYSE:MHS) remains on track, and synergies are expected to be worth around $1B. The firm also isn't concerned about fears of lost business with Walgreen (WAG).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • CASY

    Casey's General Stores (CASY +4.1%) posts a strong gain after Northcoast Research upgrades...

    Casey's General Stores (CASY +4.1%) posts a strong gain after Northcoast Research upgrades shares to a Buy rating, helping win back ground lost after last week's earnings miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • XRAY

    Dentsply International (XRAY -1.7%) and Align Technology (ALGN -3.5%) are both lower this...

    Dentsply International (XRAY -1.7%) and Align Technology (ALGN -3.5%) are both lower this morning after Morgan Stanley initiates with tepid coverage, starting Dentsply with an equal-weight and Align with an underweight. Morgan says that demand for digital dental equipment should hold up if the economy weakens, but discretionary treatments are likely to come under pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • RGR

    Shares of Sturm, Ruger (RGR -5.3%) turn lower after a concealed guns bill allowing state...

    Shares of Sturm, Ruger (RGR -5.3%) turn lower after a concealed guns bill allowing state reciprocity hits a speedbump in Congress, and looks like it could face a legal challenge if passed. The stock has gained 49% over the last 6 months on enthusiasm the concealed-carry law will significantly boost gun sales across the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 3 Comments
  • CWTR

    Women's apparel retailer Coldwater Creek (CWTR +10.8%) jumps on reports that its Chairman and...

    Women's apparel retailer Coldwater Creek (CWTR +10.8%) jumps on reports that its Chairman and CEO Dennis Pence purchased over 685K shares (I, II) last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • MRVL

    In addition to Cavium (CAVM +4.5% - previously), several other network processor vendors are up...

    In addition to Cavium (CAVM +4.5% - previously), several other network processor vendors are up following Broadcom's (BRCM -2.3%) buyout of NetLogic (NETL +50.2%), as the deal raises hopes of further moves from big-name chipmakers. EZCH +6.5%. IPHI +7%. MLNX +3.1%. MRVL +2.1%. AMCC +1.3%. PMCS +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (GS -2.2%) slips below $100 for the first time since March 2009. However, the...

    Goldman Sachs (GS -2.2%) slips below $100 for the first time since March 2009. However, the shares are nowhere near their financial crisis lows - hit in November 2008 at just above $50.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • DAR

    Darling International (DAR -5.5%) gets hit this morning after Goldman cuts it to neutral on...

    Darling International (DAR -5.5%) gets hit this morning after Goldman cuts it to neutral on valuation, citing a lack of near-term catalysts for the food recycler.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (ORCL +0.8%) is outperforming after Heather Bellini adds the enterprise software giant to...

    Oracle (ORCL +0.8%) is outperforming after Heather Bellini adds the enterprise software giant to Goldman's Conviction List, believing Oracle's huge maintenance revenue stream makes it a safe harbor in a difficult macro environment. As proof, Bellini notes how the company's EPS barely declined during the '08-'09 recession. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (CLH +1.8%) is higher this morning after J.P. Morgan ups the shares to overweight...

    Clean Harbors (CLH +1.8%) is higher this morning after J.P. Morgan ups the shares to overweight on valuation. The firm says hazardous waste disposal is a "recession-resistant" business, so the company's near-term outlook won't be hit by any weakening of the economy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • NTSP

    Shares of NetSpend (NTSP +12.5%) pop after M&A chatter swirls around the firm and rival...

    Shares of NetSpend (NTSP +12.5%) pop after M&A chatter swirls around the firm and rival Green Dot (GDOT +3.5%) receives a favorable report from Wedbush highlighted with an Outperform rating. The sector should get a hard look from investors this week with the Jefferies 2011 Electronics Payments Summitt in full swing in New York.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • MFW

    MacAndrews & Forbes buys M&F Worldwide (NYSE:MFW) in a $25 per share cash deal, upping...

    MacAndrews & Forbes buys M&F Worldwide (NYSE:MFW) in a $25 per share cash deal, upping an earlier offer. Shares of MFW are up 20% premarket after the merger announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Off the lows: European shares bounce about 1%, perhaps helped by word the Troika will release...

    Off the lows: European shares bounce about 1%, perhaps helped by word the Troika will release the next trance of the Greek bailout, allowing the country to pay its bills for a few more months. Stoxx 50 -3.9%, Germany -3.1%, France -4.2%. The euro is now green vs. the dollar at $1.3664.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • MRVL

    Shares of Cavium (CAVM) are up 7.4% premarket on interest stoked up after the Broadcom (BRCM)...

    Shares of Cavium (CAVM) are up 7.4% premarket on interest stoked up after the Broadcom (BRCM) buyout of NetLogic (NASDAQ:NETL).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM

  • The euro continues on a steady rise from overnight, when it hit a 7 month low vs. the greenback...

    The euro continues on a steady rise from overnight, when it hit a 7 month low vs. the greenback of $1.35. The common currency has returned to unchanged at 1.3640. The Swiss stay true to their word, keeping the euro treading above CHF 1.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • NETL

    Shares of NetLogic (NASDAQ:NETL) soar 51% premarket after Broadcom (BRCM) snatches up the firm...

    Shares of NetLogic (NASDAQ:NETL) soar 51% premarket after Broadcom (BRCM) snatches up the firm with a $3.7B offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • CSCO

    Quick take on Broadcom/NetLogic: Though some overlap exists between the companies' product...

    Quick take on Broadcom/NetLogic: Though some overlap exists between the companies' product lines, the deal will improve the breadth of Broadcom's solutions in the increasingly competitive market for network processors used in data centers and telecom gear, a market that should get a boost from Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) looming R&D cuts.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 AM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM) agrees to buy NetLogic Microsystems (NASDAQ:NETL) for $3.7B in a definitive...

    Broadcom (BRCM) agrees to buy NetLogic Microsystems (NASDAQ:NETL) for $3.7B in a definitive merger agreement expected to close in the first half of 2012. The firm calls the deal a "strategic fit" that should deliver financial results. Rivals in the space potentially seeing interest: LSI-OLD, CAVM, MRVL, VTSS, FSL, PMCS, AMCC.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 AM
  • SCGLY

    SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) surprised markets by saying it will cut jobs and costs and sell toxic...

    SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) surprised markets by saying it will cut jobs and costs and sell toxic assets worth €4B to bolster its balance sheet. The move was apparently intended to mitigate some of the damage from a potential Moody's downgrade, but jitters over European banks' exposure to a Greece default continue to roil investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 AM
  • DB

    Elsewhere in Europe, banks are in worse shape than in the U.K., with Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB)...

    Elsewhere in Europe, banks are in worse shape than in the U.K., with Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) -9.8% in Frankfurt and ING (NYSE:ING) -8.4% as Greece's 1-year debt soars to 108%, signalling an imminent default.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 AM

  • A sea of red in overseas trading: Hong Kong (-4.2%) leads Asia losers; Tokyo fell 2.3%, and...

    A sea of red in overseas trading: Hong Kong (-4.2%) leads Asia losers; Tokyo fell 2.3%, and India is -2.7%. In Europe after one hour, Paris is -4.7%, Frankfurt is -2.9%, and London is -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 AM
